label: AB2C5D10E2_mP40_14_a_e_c2e_5e_e-001
title: Monoclinic Averievite [(CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$] Structure
comments:
Averievite is characterized by the presence of a backbone composed of Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$ clusters and either VO$_{4}$ or PO$_{4}$ tetrahedra. The exact structure depends on atoms added to the backbone.  We have included several averievite structures in the Encyclopedia: \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A5B10C2_mP68_14_5e_10e_2e-001}{Stoiberite}, Cu$_{5}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A18B15C10D2_hP45_164_ij_abcdei_2di_d-001}{(ClCu)$_{2}$Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C10D2_hP21_143_2a_2abcd_2b2c2d_bc-001}{Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$$\cdot$CuCl$_{2}$}, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C5D10E2_hP21_164_a_bc_de_2di_d-001}{(CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(PO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C5D10E2_mP40_14_a_e_c2e_5e_e-001}{Monoclinic (CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$} (this structure), \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C10D20E4_hP86_147_ae_c2g_d3g_2d6g_dg-001}{Trigonal (CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}, and \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB5C2D10E2_mC80_15_e_e2f_f_5f_f-001}{(KBr)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 See (Starov, 1997), (Botana, 2018), and (Kornyakov, 2021) for more information. 
 The Cs (4e) site is only 50\% occupied, so there is only one cesium atom in any primitive cell. 
 The sample described here was obtained at 295K by (Botana, 2018).  At 400K they find a trigonal structure quite similar to \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C5D10E2_hP21_164_a_bc_de_2di_d-001}{(CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(PO$_{4}$)$_{2}$} which differs from the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C10D20E4_hP86_147_ae_c2g_d3g_2d6g_dg-001}{trigonal structure} described by (Kornyakov, 2021).
